name: Alice McLafferty

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Welcome to the Crimson Caravan Company, New Vegas branch. What may I do for you?

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: It's been a pleasure.

topics.topic_text: I'm looking for work.
topics.response_text: I'm afraid we have no current openings for caravaneers or guards, but I'm in need of a runner.

topics.topic_text: I'll take it. What do I need to do?
topics.response_text: Deliver this invoice to Dr. Hildern. You can find him somewhere inside Camp McCarran.

topics.topic_text: Actually, I don't have time for this right now.
topics.response_text: {slightly annoyed - player asked for work, then turned down the job}I see. Was there anything else, then?

topics.topic_text: I delivered the invoice, just as you asked.
topics.response_text: Well, you've proven yourself reliable so far. Would you be interested in more important jobs?

topics.topic_text: What other work do you have available?
topics.response_text: As much as I like to handle matters personally, I can't be everywhere at once.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to know more about the Crimson Caravan Company.
topics.response_text: Certainly. What would you like to know?

topics.topic_text: How long have you been in business?
topics.response_text: The Crimson Caravan Company has been in business for over 130 years. We're partially responsible for the progress in the NCR.

topics.topic_text: Does the Crimson Caravan have any competition?
topics.response_text: Well, the Gun Runners continue to dominate the weapons market, and the Mormon traders from New Canaan control the majority of the northern routes.

topics.topic_text: You're well-dressed for this place.
topics.response_text: Normally, I oversee company operations at the Hub in California. However, the New Vegas branch has been underperforming in recent years.

topics.topic_text: I don't have any more questions. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: All right. Is there anything else I can do for you?

topics.topic_text: The Crimson Caravan Company no longer has to worry about Henry Jamison.
topics.response_text: Yes, I'd heard something about his untimely death. There will be a lot of questions from his family, so I trust you had nothing to do with this.

topics.topic_text: Cassidy Caravans has been bought out, and is now part of the Crimson Caravan Company.
topics.response_text: Very good. On occasion it's proven to be more profitable in the long run to simply buy out the competition, and this is one of those occasions.

topics.topic_text: I have the Gun Runner holotape.
topics.response_text: {Alarm, no deaths}The Gun Runners detected an intruder roaming around, so they'll like be aware of the theft soon enough.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the negotiation.
topics.response_text: There's a small trading outfit, Cassidy Caravans, that I'm interested in acquiring. They've been rather competitive, so it's time to buy them out.

topics.topic_text: I want to know more about the problem with Henry Jamison.
topics.response_text: The Jamisons are very wealthy ranchers back in Redding, California and significant investors in the Crimson Caravan Company.

topics.topic_text: Janet's asked me to talk to you about releasing her from her contract.
topics.response_text: {snorting, a bit contemptuous}Ah, yes, her infatuation with a Boomer she's never met. It's a small camp, and word gets around.

topics.topic_text: What's the Gun Runner job about?
topics.response_text: The quality of the Gun Runners' armaments is due to their manufacturing process. They craft all weapons on-site.

topics.topic_text: I'll see what I can do.
topics.response_text: Thank you. Was there something else?

topics.topic_text: I need to be reminded about a job you wanted me to do.
topics.response_text: {Non-Dummy}Of course. Which one?

topics.topic_text: Are you really going to ruin what's supposed to be a time of happiness for her?
topics.response_text: {grumbling}[SUCCEEDED] Being sentimental is not how I made the Crimson Caravan so successful, but I'll allow it, just this once.

topics.topic_text: You'll have to find someone else for the Gun Runner job. That's not something I do.
topics.response_text: I understand. No hard feelings, but you will, of course, keep our conversation on the matter strictly confidential.

topics.topic_text: Opening up trade with the Boomers would be easier with Janet in their camp, wouldn't you agree?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Intriguing. Janet puts in a good word for me, and the Crimson Caravan gains exclusive access to the Boomers. Yes, that works for me.

topics.topic_text: I need to consider your offer.
topics.response_text: Take all the time you need.

topics.topic_text: You have a deal.
topics.response_text: I'm glad to hear it.

topics.topic_text: Are work contracts common for the Crimson Caravan Company?
topics.response_text: Most merchant companies -{correcting herself, emphasizes "successful"}successful merchant companies, rather - have them. It can be inconvenient to replace employees on short notice.

topics.topic_text: What kind of upkeep expenses?
topics.response_text: Food, water, living quarters, medicine, and clothes - just the basic stuff. It all comes out of the Company's coffers.

topics.topic_text: Are work contracts legal?
topics.response_text: Yes, and they have been for decades now. The hired hands know what they're signing up for - we don't hide anything with fancy talk.

topics.topic_text: It seems like that the companies are getting the better deal.
topics.response_text: {grinning}That's because we are.{more serious}We always pay up when the contract ends, though. Won't stay in business long if you've got a reputation as a cheat.

topics.topic_text: Is there anything else you need me to do?
topics.response_text: Something has actually come up. A prospector recently came through here and spent a lot of caps on supplies.

topics.topic_text: I had some questions about bottle cap currency.
topics.response_text: What would you like to know?

topics.topic_text: The bottle cap press is no longer a problem.
topics.response_text: Good. I'm sure you were thorough. Here's your payment for a job well done.

topics.topic_text: Why is a bottle cap press a problem for you?
topics.response_text: People have been counterfeiting bottle caps forever, but it's always been small scale.

topics.topic_text: Are new bottle caps ever made?
topics.response_text: Certainly. Bottle caps do wear out or get damaged. Some people even insist on using bottle caps in explosive devices for some reason.

topics.topic_text: What makes a bottle cap genuine?
topics.response_text: Lots of little things - the paint on the label, the machining, the type of metal it's made from.

topics.topic_text: I'm looking for Cass. The Van Graffs told me to check in with you.
topics.response_text: {Cass not hired}Coincidentally, I'm also looking for her. I've got a business offer she'd be interested in.

topics.topic_text: Cass isn't around anymore, so I won't be able to complete the negotiation for you.
topics.response_text: A pity. I guess I'll have to find some other way to acquire her caravan's assets. Thanks for letting me know.

description:
Alice McLafferty is a 48 year-old Caucasian Female.

Alice McLafferty is a middle-aged woman with a stern, business-like demeanor. Her sharp eyes and no-nonsense attitude reflect her years of experience in the cutthroat world of post-apocalyptic commerce. She maintains a professional appearance with practical clothing suitable for travel and business negotiations.

Alice McLafferty's Personality: Alice is pragmatic, calculating, and ruthless in her business dealings. She values efficiency and profit above all else, showing little patience for incompetence or sentimentality. Despite her cold exterior, she possesses a keen strategic mind and is adept at navigating the complex political landscape of the Mojave Wasteland.

Alice McLafferty's Backstory: Alice McLafferty spent the majority of her career managing operations for the Crimson Caravan Company in the Hub, one of the most significant trading hubs in the wasteland. By the early 2280s, she was transferred to oversee their struggling New Vegas branch, which had been underperforming under the leadership of the incompetent CEO Henry Jamison. Recognizing the need for drastic measures to restore profitability, Alice began implementing aggressive business strategies to expand Crimson Caravan's influence in the Mojave.
